title: Between 1 July 2017 and 30 June 2018, will an armed group from the Central African Republic engage in a campaign that systematically kills 1,000 or more civilians in the Central African Republic?
preds: Based on general news and GJP consensus.

From Sept 10 -- "Central African Republic: Rising Ethnic Tensions Fuel Fear of Spike in Violence"
"U.N. Undersecretary-General for Peacekeeping Operations Jean-Pierre Lacroix says ethnic hate speech is running in parallel with an increase in violence in the Central African Republic. And, he says, he finds this very worrisome."
"We are seeing a surge in very negative messages, very negative antagonistic rhetoric to the effect that 'foreigners should be eliminated.' Sort of putting one ethnic component or religious component of this country against the other and this is very worrying and serious." http://allafrica.com/stories/201709100041.html *Note that this is an EWP staff account. We post relevant articles and engage in discussions with forecasters. However, we always forecast the current consensus so as not to influence participants' forecasts in either direction.

A couple updates to consider as you update your forecasts:  From UN emergency relief coordinator Stephen O'Brien on August 7: "We cannot under-estimate the dangerous spread of militant groups in CAR, some of which have the clear intention to ethnically cleanse. Let me repeat this, as I have told Mr. Zeid and Mr. Adama Dieng. The early warning signs of a genocide are there. We must act now, not pare down the UN’s effort and pray we don’t live to regret it. I repeat the phrase: how many more clues do we need?"  http://www.unocha.org/sites/unocha/files/statement-and-speech/ERC_USG%20Stephen%20O%27Brien%20Statement%20to%20the%20Memeber%20States%20on%20DRC%20and%20CAR%20-%2007Aug2017.pdf From Medecins Sans Frontieres: "MSF has warned that civilians are increasingly being subjected to attacks or counterattacks based on their ethnicity or religion. A willingness among armed groups and their local supporters to prevent the “enemy” from getting assistance has also been noted." https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2017/sep/01/people-are-dying-violence-forces-aid-workers-out-of-central-african-republic *Note that this is an EWP staff account. We post relevant articles and engage in discussions with forecasters. However, we always forecast the current consensus so as not to influence participants' forecasts in either direction.
Based on general news and GJP consensus.

How Can the UN Curb CAR’s Spiral of Violence and Ethnic Cleansing? // IPI Global Observatory
https://theglobalobservatory.org/2017/08/central-african-republic-united-nations-minusca/ "Earlier this month, United Nations Under-Secretary-General for Humanitarian Affairs Stephen O’Brien issued an alarming call to address “early warning signs of genocide” in the Central African Republic (CAR). The nature and dynamics of the conflict affecting the country have dramatically evolved in the past few months, and recent episodes of violence have amounted, at a minimum, to ethnic cleansing. What seemed to be a contest between armed groups for economic and political gains has increasingly been entangled with renewed inter-communal, inter-ethnic, and inter-confessional hatred, especially in the central and eastern parts of the country." *Note that this is an EWP staff account. We post relevant articles and engage in discussions with forecasters. However, we always forecast the current consensus so as not to influence participants' forecasts in either direction.

http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2017/08/30-civilians-killed-car-clashes-170809222933535.html
They're working on it.  This will likely come down to what the scorers decide to count.

http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2017/08/sees-early-warning-signs-genocide-car-170807215828039.html  NEWSCENTRAL AFRICAN REPUBLIC10 HOURS AGO
UN sees early warning signs of genocide in CAR
The UN is calling for more peacekeeping forces to be deployed in the Central African Republic amid renewed clashes.
Emerging reports of persistent forced expulsions, large scale retributions, leading to even  UN peacekeepers being killed, leads up to this!

From my research, I found that in modern African Civil wars, around 80% of them have documented groups murdering over 1,000 civilians at a time, systematically. Therefore, I start at a base of 80%. On the wikipedia page, it states in 2013, there already was a civilian massacre of thousands of men and women, and there are many documented cases of civilians being murdered for no reason. This Civil war is based much on religion, which causes me to believe there is a higher chance that some sort of ethnic/religious cleansing will occur in the future.  Lastly, in June, many of the armed groups in the CAR including one of the most dangerous factions (FPRC) signed a ceasefire in Rome. However, that same month, a faction of FPRC and whom they're warring with (antibalaka militias) ended up getting into a gun fight over which group has control over mines. Therefore, this ceasefire more or less proves to be irrelevant, and that the killings will continue.
Based on general news and GJP consensus.

http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2017/07/rising-violence-forces-40000-flee-car-east-170710175551526.html
They are trying diligently, but probably can't make the numbers.

Central African Republic probably has a current situation where civilians are being systematically killed.  According to Human Rights Watch, civilians are being actively targeted in a war taking place now.  The United Nations is reporting violence targeting their workers.  The end of June of 2018 is a long time from now and genocidal type killings are already happening.  In my mind, the matter at hand is when the threshold of 1,000 is met, opposed to if a genocide will take place.   https://www.hrw.org/news/2017/07/05/central-african-republic-civilians-targeted-war
http://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsID=57113#.WV1OdoTyvIU
http://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-13150040
The trend is in the other direction, thank God
